issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Initial setup was as follows:

CLC/Walrus x 2
CC x 2
SC x 1 (using DAS, no HA)
NC x 2

After de-registration of secondary components, setup looks like the following:

CLC/Walrus x 1
CC x 1
SC x 1 (using DAS)
NC x 2

_CC and SC are co-located on the same machine currently_.

From the behavior of the cloud (i.e. not being able to associate an elastic IP address to the instance), it looks like the ENABLED secondary components (CLC,CC,Walrus) were de-registered.  De-registration did take place, but not sure if the ENABLED components were de-registered or DISABLED components were de-registered.  Based on this behavior, there looks to be some DB corruption.

Seems to have a network failure and then got hit with the instance restore issue (EUCA-3795, EUCA-4327, EUCA-3879, EUCA-3866).

We identified one instance in the instance restore path, and destroyed it on the NC.

After that we try to ssh to an instance , we cannot do so, we tried to allocate an elastic IP address, associate it , but it does not get associate.

What is concerning is that,
euca-describe-instances verbose <instance ID> , shows an IP address for public and private but when we do euca-describe-addresses | grep <public ip> , the IP appears to be available and not associated with any instance.

We tried rebooting the instance as well, but it is still not accessible.
fields.summary: Not able to associate IP address to instances after de-registration of components in HA Setup

comments.body:

Closing items resolved completed for released versions of the software.
